intro: Streptocarpus caulescens, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, tubular leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers well-drained conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in spring and summer. Streptocarpus caulescens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
